aws::graph::propositions: # Pilot and Helicopter Accident Information
The pilot held a Commercial certificate.
The pilot held a Flight instructor certificate.
The pilot was 55 years old.
The pilot was male.
The pilot had no Airplane Rating.
The pilot occupied the right seat.
The pilot held a Helicopter Rating.
The pilot used a 3-point restraint.
The pilot held an Instrument Rating for Helicopter.
No second pilot was present.
The pilot held Instructor Ratings for Helicopter.
The pilot held Instructor Ratings for Instrument helicopter.
No toxicology was performed on the pilot.
The pilot held a Class 2 Medical Certification with waivers/limitations.
The pilot's last Federal Aviation Administration Medical Exam was on August 18, 2014.
The pilot was an occupational pilot.
The pilot's last Flight Review or Equivalent was on May 6, 2014.
The pilot had an estimated 2296 total flight hours in all aircraft.
The pilot had 1790 total flight hours in this make and model.
The pilot had 2247 Pilot In Command hours in all aircraft.
The pilot had 111 flight hours in the last 90 days in all aircraft.
The pilot had 32 flight hours in the last 30 days in all aircraft.
The pilot had 0 flight hours in the last 24 hours in all aircraft.
The helicopter's main gear box was examined.
No anomalies were noted in the helicopter's main gear box.
The helicopter's drive system was examined.
No anomalies were noted in the helicopter's drive system.
Flight control continuity was established with the cyclic.
Flight control continuity was established with the collective.
Tail rotor continuity was established in each direction from the separation point.
The helicopter's maintenance records were reviewed.
The helicopter's engine underwent its most recent annual inspection on December 04, 2013.
The helicopter's airframe underwent its most recent annual inspection on December 04, 2013.
The helicopter had an airframe total time of 444.3 hours at the time of the most recent annual inspection.
The helicopter had an engine total time of 444.3 hours at the time of the most recent annual inspection.
A Global Positioning System device was located in the wreckage.
The Global Positioning System device was sent to the National Transportation Safety Board Vehicle Recorder Division for examination and readout.
The Global Positioning System device did not contain any specific information relevant to the accident.

text:
# Pilot Information

## Pilot Information

| Certificate | Commercial; Flight instructor |
| --- | --- |
| Age | 55,Male |
| Airplane Rating(s) | None |
| Seat Occupied | Right |
| Other Aircraft Rating(s) | Helicopter |
| Restraint Used | 3-point |
| Instrument Rating(s) | Helicopter |
| Second Pilot Present | No |
| Instructor Rating(s) | Helicopter; Instrument helicopter |
| Toxicology Performed | No |
| Medical Certification | Class 2 With waivers/limitations |
| Last FAA Medical Exam | August 18, 2014 |
| Occupational Pilot | Yes |
| Last Flight Review or Equivalent | May 6, 2014 |
| Flight Time | (Estimated) 2296 hours (Total, all aircraft), 1790 hours (Total, this make and model), 2247 hours (Pilot In Command, all aircraft), 111 hours (Last 90 days, all aircraft), 32 hours (Last 30 days, all aircraft), 0 hours (Last 24 hours, all aircraft) |

The helicopter's main gear box and drive system were examined and no anomalies were noted. Flight control continuity was established with the cyclic and collective. Tail rotor continuity was established in each direction from the separation point.

A review of the helicopter's maintenance records revealed that the engine and airframe underwent their most recent annual inspection on December 04, 2013, at an airframe and engine total time of 444.3 hours.

A Global Positioning System device was located in the wreckage and sent to the NTSB Vehicle Recorder Division for examination and readout. The device did not contain any specific information relevant to the accident.

---
